info.description:
![DoneDone Logo](https://2.donedone.com/content/shared/img/dd-logo.svg)
**Looking for the DoneDone Classic API?** [We've got them right here.](https://donedone.com/api/classic/v2)

# 1. Introduction
We offer a RESTful API that allows you to work with DoneDone data for your own applications. All methods from the API use either the `GET`, `POST`, `PUT`, or `DELETE` verbs and return standard JSON-serialized objects.

## 1.1 The API explorer
This API explorer allows you to make authenticated calls to your DoneDone account, so you can easily test requests and responses. **Calls using this API count against your rate limit(see below)**.

## 1.2 Request URLs
All requests begin with **https://2.donedone.com/public-api/{accountID}**. Your account ID is the same value as the value of the URL when accessing the web app (e.g. **https://2-app.donedone.com/123** or **https://2.donedone.com/app/123/account/profile**).

# 2. Requests and responses
All responses are sent in JSON format with standard HTTP codes depending on the nature of the response.The example values for responses in this API explorer are all in JSON format. When sending JSON data to the API in a POST or PUT, you have to send the Content - Type header `Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8`. However, you may also send the same data as form variables as well using the identical names provided in the JSON examples.

## 2.1 Success responses

All successful responses, regardless of the type of HTTP verb used, will return a `200` status. Use this API explorer below to view the actual data returned from these responses.

## 2.2 Error responses

All error responses will return a `message` property at the root of the JSON response with further detail about the error. Here are the HTTP status codes you can anticipate:

* `400`: Method could not be executed due to bad request parameters.
* `401`: You are not authenticated or your authentication is no longer valid.
* `402`: The account is suspended. The account owner must reactivate the account.
* `403`: You do not have permission to access this resource.
* `404`: This resource is not found.
* `429`: The API rate limit has been exceeded for the time frame.
* `500`: Something unexpected occurred. If this is a recurring issue, [contact us](https://donedone.com/help-center) and we'll investigate.
* `503`: The API is inaccessible. (No `message` property will be sent back in this case, since the actual API is down.)

# 3. Authentication
We support **HTTP Basic authentication** to access the API. The DoneDone API is only available over SSL, so your credentials are safe.

When making calls to the API, provide your email address and api token via the [HTTP Basic authorization header](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Authorization), in the form: `Authorization: Basic xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx` where `xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx` is the Base64-encoded string in the form `email:apitoken`. Your unique API token is available on the "Your Profile > API Key" section of the DoneDone app.
You may also use your password in place of the api token, but we don't recommend this.

# 4. Rate limiting
You can make up to **500 requests to the API per account every 30 minutes**. If you exceed the rate limit, API responses will return a `429` Rate Limit HTTP status code and message. When you receive this response, check the `Retry-After` header to see how many seconds you have to wait until you are permitted to make requests again.
info.title: DoneDone2 Public API

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description: Methods to access user information for all of their accounts.

tags.name: Calendar
tags.description: Methods related to daily activity and due dates.

tags.name: Conversations
tags.description: Methods related to creating, accessing, and managing conversations.

tags.name: Files
tags.description: Methods for accessing, uploading, and deleting files.

tags.name: Projects
tags.description: Methods for creating, accessing, and managing projects and project settings.

tags.name: Mailboxes
tags.description: Methods for creating, accessing, and managing mailboxes and mailbox settings.

tags.name: Profile
tags.description: Methods for accessing user profile or authentication information.

tags.name: Search
tags.description: Methods related to global text search of mailboxes, conversations, projects, and tasks.

tags.name: Tasks
tags.description: Methods related to creating, accessing, and managing tasks.

get.summary: Returns the accounts the user has access to.
Returns a list of days that have items due based on the passed-in criteria.

parameters.name: entity_id
parameters.description: ID of mailbox/project from the `listEntities` array in the **filter-options** endpoint. If blank, will return data from all available mailboxes and projects.

parameters.name: people_ids
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of IDs from the `listCompanies` > `listPeople` arrays in the **filter-options** endpoint

parameters.name: start_date_range
parameters.description: Start of date range expressed in any parsable date form (e.g. Jan 15, 2019 or 2019-01-15, etc.)

parameters.name: end_date_range
parameters.description: Start of date range expressed in any parsable date form (e.g. Jan 15, 2019 or 2019-01-15, etc.)

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **daysWithDeadlines** - List of days that have at least one deadline associated to the parameters applied to the request.

get.summary: Returns a collection of options for filtering on other Calendar methods.

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **listEntities** - Includes both projects and mailboxes available for calendar filtering.

get.summary: Returns due items and activity for a given day.

parameters.name: entity_id
parameters.description: ID of mailbox/project from the `listEntities` array in the **filter-options** endpoint. If blank, will return data from all available mailboxes and projects.

parameters.name: people_ids
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of IDs from the `listCompanies` > `listPeople` arrays in the **filter-options** endpoint

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Start of date range expressed in any parsable date form (e.g. Jan 15, 2019 or 2019-01-15, etc.)

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **listDeadlines** - List of all tasks and conversations due on the `day` and who's assigned to them.
 * **listActivity** - List of all actions that took place on the `day`.

get.summary: Returns a list of conversations that match the filter criteria.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page to return (50 items per page). If blank, defaults to page 1.

parameters.name: default_filter_id
parameters.description: ID of default filter (see **filter-options** GET endpoint for valid IDs in `listDefaultFilters`)

parameters.name: custom_filter_id
parameters.description: ID of custom filter (see **filter-options** GET endpoint for valid IDs in `listCustomFilters`)

parameters.name: including_tag_ids
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of one or more matching tag IDs (see **filter-options** GET endpoint for valid IDs in `listTags`)

parameters.name: not_including_tag_ids
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of one or more tag IDs that an item is not tagged with (see **filter-options** GET endpoint for valid IDs in `listTags`)

parameters.name: start_due_date
parameters.description: Due date start range expressed in any distinguishable form (e.g. Jan 15, 2019 or 2019-01-15, etc.)

parameters.name: end_due_date
parameters.description: Due date end range expressed in any distinguishable form (e.g. Jan 15, 2019 or 2019-01-15, etc.)

parameters.name: due
parameters.description: Due date range specified from today

parameters.name: due_type
parameters.description: Alternative to the `due` field (Anytime = 1, Now = 2, This Week = 3, Range = 4)

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: Search term to search against all content within an item.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **message** - Use non-styled basic HTML tags only.
 * **assigneeID** - IDs can be found in the `listAssignees` array from the **/conversations/filter-options** GET endpoint. To leave unassigned, omit or set to 0.
 * **statusID** - IDs can be found in the `listStatuses` array from the **/conversations/filter-options** GET endpoint.
 * **priorityID** - IDs can be found in the `listPriorities` array from the **/conversations/filter-options** GET endpoint.
 * **dueDate** - Date can be in any parsable string format. Omit or pass `null` for no due date.
 * **listWatchersIDs** - IDs can be found in the `listWatchers` array from the **/conversations/filter-options** GET endpoint.
 * **listAtMentionIDs** - IDs can be found in the `listAtMentionUsers` array from the **/tasks/filter-options** GET endpoint.
 * **listFileUploadIDs** - IDs come from the `id` field in the response to the **Files** POST calls and must be posted by the same user who is adding the comment.

get.summary: Gets the details of a conversation.

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **dueDate** - The date this conversation is due in ISO format.
 * **id** - IDs are a unique global identifier for a conversation.
 * **refNumber** - Reference numbers start at 1 and increment for an account.
 * **originalAttachments** - A list of attachments tied to the original message created for this conversation (not subsequent comments or replies).
 * **replySignature** - This is automatically applied to the end of any replies to the customer.
 * **harvestEnabled** - If true, the Harvest timer button is exposed on the conversation detail page.
 * **previousItem** - Holds the ID, mailbox/project ID and type of the previous item.
 * **nextItem** - Holds the ID, mailbox/project ID and type of the next item.

put.summary: Updates assignee for a conversation.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **assigneeID** - IDs can be found in the `listAssignees` array from the **filter-options** GET endpoint for this conversation. To unassign, omit or set to 0.

post.summary: Adds a comment to a conversation.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **message** - Use non-styled basic HTML tags only.
 * **listFileUploadIDs** - IDs come from the `id` field in the response to the **Files** POST calls and must be posted by the same user who is adding the comment.

put.summary: Edits a comment for a conversation.

parameters.name: convo_event_id
parameters.description: ID of conversation event. Use the `id` values in the **history** GET endpoint to find available event IDs.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **message** - Use non-styled basic HTML tags only.
 * **listAtMentionIDs** - IDs can be found in the `listAtMentionUsers` array from the **filter-options** GET endpoint for this conversation.
 * **listFileUploadIDs** - IDs come from the `id` field in the response to the **Files** POST calls and must be posted by the same user who is editing the comment.
 * **listRemovedAttachmentIDs** - Use the `id` values in the `attachments` array for the history record you are referencing in the **history** GET endpoint to find available attachments to remove.

put.summary: Updates the customer for a conversation.
Updates due date for a conversation.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **dueDate** - To remove the due date, omit or pass `null`.

get.summary: Returns available options (e.g. tags, people, statuses, etc.) for updating this conversation.

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **listWatchers** - All people that can watch this conversation.
 * **listAtMentionUsers** - On the app, the `Label` field identifies how to @-mention someone on this conversation. @-mentioned users are automatically added as watchers.
 * **listAssignees** - All people that can be assigned to this conversation.
 * **listCustomers** - All customers that have interacted with a conversation in this mailbox.
 * **listTags** - All tags associated to at least one conversation in this mailbox.
 * **listPriorities** - All priorities this conversation can have.
 * **listStatuses** - All statuses this conversation can move to. Will depend on its current status.

get.summary: Gets the history of this conversation.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort chronologically or reverse-chronologically. Default is reverse.

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **id** - The unique global identifier for this conversation event.
 * **isConvoThread** - Determines if this event is part of the email thread with the customer.
 * **canEdit** - Determines if the logged-in user can edit the comment to this event.
 * **isEdited** - Determines if the comment was already edited previously.
 * **stylizedHtmlVersion** - Displays the original HTML version of an incoming conversation from the customer, if applicable.
 * **description** - HTML-formatted description (comment/reply) for this event.
 * **attachments** - The list of attachments added to this event.

get.summary: Gets other conversations associated to the same customer.

put.summary: Updates priority for a conversation.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **priorityID** - IDs can be found in the `listPriorities` array from the **filter-options** GET endpoint for this conversation.

post.summary: Adds a reply to the customer only.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **message** - Use non-styled basic HTML tags only.
 * **listFileUploadIDs** - IDs come from the `id` field in the response to the **Files** POST calls and must be posted by the same user who is adding the reply.

get.summary: Gets saved replies available for this conversation.

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **body** - The body of the reply, with any dynamic variables replaced with real values.

put.summary: Updates status for a conversation.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **statusID** - IDs can be found in the `listStatuses` array from the **filter-options** GET endpoint for this conversation.

put.summary: Updates the subject of a conversation.
Updates tags for a conversation.
Updates watchers for a conversation.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **listWatcherIDs** - IDs can be found in the `listWatchers` array from the **filter-options** GET endpoint for this conversation.

post.summary: Bulk edits conversations in a mailbox.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **listConversationIDs** - Use the `listConversations` array in the **conversations** GET endpoint for valid `id` values.
 * **comment** - Adds a comment to every conversation being edited. Use non-styled basic HTML tags only.
 * **actionID** - Comment Only = 1, Priority Level = 2, Status = 3, Assignee = 4, Mailbox = 5, Update Due Date = 6, Add Tags = 7, Remove Tags = 8, Delete = 9, Remove Due Date = 10
 * **value** - The value of the edit you are making. For **tag updates**, send a comma-delimited string of tags. For **due date updates**, send a parsable date string. For status, priority or mailbox updates, send the ID of the new value. IDs can be found from the **Mailboxes > filter-options** GET endpoint for this conversation's mailbox.

get.summary: Returns available options (e.g. tags, people, statuses, etc.) for setting up a new conversation.

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **listWatchers** - All people that can watch this conversation.
 * **listAtMentionUsers** - On the app, the `Label` field identifies how to @-mention someone on this conversation. @-mentioned users are automatically added as watchers.
 * **listAssignees** - All people that can be assigned to this conversation.
 * **listCustomers** - All customers that have interacted with a conversation in this mailbox.
 * **listTags** - All tags associated to at least one conversation in this mailbox.
 * **listPriorities** - All priorities this conversation can have.
 * **listStatuses** - All statuses this conversation can move to. Will depend on its current status.

delete.summary: Deletes a file upload (or Google Drive file reference).

get.summary: Redirects to the attachment referenced by the given ID.

parameters.name: file_name
parameters.description: Name of file (for vanity of URL only)

post.summary: Uploads a file and returns the ID of the file.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **files** - A single base64 byte array representing the raw file to be uploaded.
 * **form** - The name of the file.

**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **workflowID** - IDs can be found in the array from the **workflows** GET endpoint.

get.summary: Returns project details (e.g. name, favorited, people in the project).

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **id** - Unique global identifier for the project.
 * **isFavorite** - Favorites appear on the left sidebar on the user's dashboard.
 * **listPeople** - All people with access to this project.

get.summary: Returns all people available to be assigned to the project. The "isAssigned" boolean denotes whether they are currently assigned to the project.
Returns attributes for a custom filter.

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **id** - Unique global identifier for the custom filter.
 * **listAssigneeIDs** - All assignee IDs applied to this custom filter. One must match for a task to return.
 * **listIncludingTagIDs** - All tags IDs applied to this custom filter. One or more must match for a task to return.
 * **listNotIncludingTagIDs** - All tags IDs applied to this custom filter. None must match for a task to return.
 * **listStatusIDs** - All status IDs applied to this custom filter. One must match for a task to return.
 * **listPriorityIDs** - All priority IDs applied to this custom filter. One must match for a task to return.
 * **createdOnID** - Number of days since the task was created.
 * **lastUpdatedOnID** - Number of days since the task was updated.

get.summary: Returns various lists for filtering tasks in this project.

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **listInternalProjects** - All projects that share the same workflow as this one. Tasks from this project can be moved to these projects.

get.summary: Returns general settings information for this project.
Returns the user's notification settings for the project.

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **notificationOptionID** - Assigned and watching = 1, Never email me = 2, Always email me = 3, Assigned and watching + newly created = 4

get.summary: Returns priorities available for tasks in this project.
Returns statuses available for tasks in this project.
Returns the title of a project.
Returns mailbox ID/name pairs for all projects the user has access to.
Returns all published workflows available for projects.

post.summary: Creates a new mailbox with default settings.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **workflowID** - IDs can be found in the array from the **workflows** GET endpoint.

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **incomingEmailAddress** - Generated incoming email address that creates conversations in this mailbox.

get.summary: Returns the details, including people and the reply signature, of a mailbox.

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **id** - Unique global identifier for the mailbox.
 * **isFavorite** - Favorites appear on the left sidebar on the user's dashboard.
 * **listPeople** - All people with access to this mailbox.

get.summary: Returns all people available to be assigned to the mailbox. The "isAssigned" boolean denotes whether they are currently assigned to the mailbox.
Returns auto-response settings for a mailbox.

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **id** - ID of mailbox

get.summary: Returns various lists for filtering tasks in this mailbox.

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **listMailboxes** - All mailboxes that share the same workflow as this one. Tasks from this mailbox can be moved to these mailboxes.

get.summary: Returns general settings information for this project.

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **id** - ID of mailbox

get.summary: Returns the user's notification settings for the mailbox.

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **notificationOptionID** - Assigned and watching = 1, Never email me = 2, Always email me = 3, Assigned and watching + newly created = 4

get.summary: Returns priorities available for conversations in this mailbox.
Returns saved replies for a mailbox.

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **id** - ID of mailbox

get.summary: Returns statuses available for conversations in this mailbox.
Returns the title of a mailbox.
Returns mailbox ID/name pairs for all mailboxes the user has access to.
Returns all published workflows available for mailboxes.
Returns profile information for the user.

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **accountRole** - Normal user = 1, Owner = 2, Admin = 3

post.summary: Returns matches based on a text search.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **searchTerm** - Searches the content of all tasks and conversations, as well as the names of all mailboxes and projects. Quoted text will be searched as a single phrase. Use #XXX to search for a specific item #.

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **matches** - All comments or replies with a match on the search text.
 * **projects** - All projects with a match on the search text.
 * **mailboxes** - All mailboxes with a match on the search text.

get.summary: Returns a list of tasks and counts based on filter inputs.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page to return (50 items per page). If blank, defaults to page 1.

parameters.name: default_filter_id
parameters.description: ID of default filter (see **filter-options** GET endpoint for valid IDs in `listDefaultFilters`)

parameters.name: custom_filter_id
parameters.description: ID of custom filter (see **filter-options** GET endpoint for valid IDs in `listCustomFilters`)

parameters.name: including_tag_ids
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of one or more tag IDs (see **filter-options** GET endpoint for valid IDs in `listTags`)

parameters.name: not_including_tag_ids
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of one or more tag IDs (see **filter-options** GET endpoint for valid IDs in `listTags`)

parameters.name: start_due_date
parameters.description: Due date start range expressed in any distinguishable form (e.g. Jan 15, 2019 or 2019-01-15, etc.)

parameters.name: end_due_date
parameters.description: Due date end range expressed in any distinguishable form (e.g. Jan 15, 2019 or 2019-01-15, etc.)

parameters.name: due
parameters.description: Due date range specified from today

parameters.name: due_type
parameters.description: Alternative to the `due` field (Anytime = 1, Now = 2, This Week = 3, Range = 4)

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: Search term to search against all content within an item.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **description** - Use non-styled basic HTML tags only.
 * **assigneeID** - IDs can be found in the `listAssignees` array from the **/tasks/filter-options** GET endpoint. To leave unassigned, omit or set to 0.
 * **statusID** - IDs can be found in the `listStatuses` array from the **/tasks/filter-options** GET endpoint.
 * **priorityID** - IDs can be found in the `listPriorities` array from the **/conversations/filter-options** GET endpoint.
 * **dueDate** - Date can be in any parsable string format. Omit or pass `null` for no due date.
 * **listWatchersIDs** - IDs can be found in the `listWatchers` array from the **/tasks/filter-options** GET endpoint.
 * **listAtMentionIDs** - IDs can be found in the `listAtMentionUsers` array from the **/tasks/filter-options** GET endpoint.
 * **listFileUploadIDs** - IDs come from the `id` field in the response to the **Files** POST calls and must be posted by the same user who is adding the comment.
 * **listLinkedTaskIDs** - IDs can be found in the `listLinkableTasks` array from the **/tasks/filter-options** GET endpoint. Linking tasks allow users to simultaneously update their statuses when commenting.

get.summary: Gets the details of a task.

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **dueDate** - The date this task is due in ISO format.
 * **id** - IDs are a unique global identifier for a task.
 * **refNumber** - Reference numbers start at 1 and increment for an account.
 * **originalAttachments** - A list of attachments tied to the original message created for this task (not subsequent comments).
 * **listLinkedTasks** - All tasks linked to this one (allows option to update status of these tasks when updating this task's status.
 * **harvestEnabled** - If true, the Harvest timer button is exposed on the task detail page.
 * **previousItem** - Holds the ID, mailbox/project ID and type of the previous item.
 * **nextItem** - Holds the ID, mailbox/project ID and type of the next item.

put.summary: Updates assignee for a task.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **assigneeID** - IDs can be found in the `listAssignees` array from the **filter-options** GET endpoint for this task. To unassign, omit or set to 0.

post.summary: Adds a comment to a task.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **message** - Use non-styled basic HTML tags only.
 * **listFileUploadIDs** - IDs come from the `id` field in the response to the **Files** POST calls and must be posted by the same user who is adding the comment.

put.summary: Edits a comment for a task.

parameters.name: task_event_id
parameters.description: ID of task event. Use the `id` values in the **history** GET endpoint to find available event IDs.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **message** - Use non-styled basic HTML tags only.
 * **listAtMentionIDs** - IDs can be found in the `listAtMentionUsers` array from the **filter-options** GET endpoint for this task.
 * **listFileUploadIDs** - IDs come from the `id` field in the response to the **Files** POST calls and must be posted by the same user who is adding the comment.
 * **listRemovedAttachmentIDs** - Use the `id` values in the `attachments` array for the history record you are referencing in the **history** GET endpoint to find available attachments to remove.

put.summary: Updates the description for a task and original attachments.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **description** - Use non-styled basic HTML tags only.
 * **listAtMentionIDs** - IDs can be found in the `listAtMentionUsers` array from the **filter-options** GET endpoint for this task.
 * **listFileUploadIDs** - IDs come from the `id` field in the response to the **Files** POST calls and must be posted by the same user who is adding the comment.
 * **listRemovedAttachmentIDs** - Use the `id` values in the `originalAttachments` array from the **task details** GET endpoint to find available attachments to remove.

put.summary: Updates due date for a task.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **dueDate** - To remove the due date, omit or pass `null`.

get.summary: Returns available options (e.g. tags, people, statuses, etc.) for updating this task.

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **listWatchers** - All people that can watch this task.
 * **listAtMentionUsers** - On the app, the `Label` field identifies how to @-mention someone on this task. @-mentioned users are automatically added as watchers.
 * **listAssignees** - All people that can be assigned to this task.
 * **listTags** - All tags associated to at least one task in this mailbox.
 * **listPriorities** - All priorities this task can have.
 * **listStatuses** - All statuses this conversation can move to. Will depend on its current status.
 * **listDescriptionTemplates** - A list of templates to start a new task description with.
 * **listLinkableTasks** - All tasks that can be linked to this one. Linked tasks allow you to automatically update the statuses of other tasks when changing the status of this one. DEPRECATED AND WILL BE REMOVED in favor of /linkable-tasks.

get.summary: Gets the history of this task.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort chronologically or reverse-chronologically. Default is reverse.

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **id** - The unique global identifier for this task event.
 * **canEdit** - Determines if the logged-in user can edit the comment to this event.
 * **isEdited** - Determines if the comment was already edited previously.
 * **description** - HTML-formatted comment for this event.
 * **attachments** - The list of attachments added to this event.

get.summary: Returns a list of linkable tasks for this task.

put.summary: Overwrites linked tasks for a task.
put.description: Pass `null` or an empty array to remove all linked tasks.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **listLinkedTaskIDs** - IDs can be found in the `listLinkableTasks` array from the **filter-options** GET endpoint for this task.

put.summary: Updates priority for a task.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **priorityID** - IDs can be found in the `listPriorities` array from the **filter-options** GET endpoint for this task.

put.summary: Updates status for a task.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **statusID** - IDs can be found in the `listStatuses` array from the **filter-options** GET endpoint for this task.

put.summary: Updates tags for a task.
Updates the title for a task.
DEPRECATED. Updates title and description for a task.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **description** - Use non-styled basic HTML tags only.

put.summary: Updates watchers for a task.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **listWatcherIDs** - IDs can be found in the `listWatchers` array from the **filter-options** GET endpoint for this task.

post.summary: Bulk edits tasks in a project.

requestBody.description:
**Notes on request body properties:**
 * **listTaskIDs** - Use the `listTasks` array in the **tasks** GET endpoint for valid `id` values.
 * **comment** - Adds a comment to every task being edited. Use non-styled basic HTML tags only.
 * **actionID** - Comment Only = 1, Priority Level = 2, Status = 3, Assignee = 4, Project = 5, Update Due Date = 6, Add Tags = 7, Remove Tags = 8, Delete = 9, Remove Due Date = 10
 * **value** - The value of the edit you are making. For **tag updates**, send a comma-delimited string of tags. For **due date updates**, send a parsable date string. For status, priority, or project updates, send the ID of the new value. IDs can be found from the **Projects > filter-options** GET endpoint for this task's project.

get.summary: Returns available options (e.g. tags, people, statuses, etc.) for setting up a new task.

200.description:
**Notes on response body properties:**
 * **listWatchers** - All people that can watch this task.
 * **listAtMentionUsers** - On the app, the `Label` field identifies how to @-mention someone on this task. @-mentioned users are automatically added as watchers.
 * **listAssignees** - All people that can be assigned to this task.
 * **listTags** - All tags associated to at least one task in this mailbox.
 * **listPriorities** - All priorities this task can have.
 * **listStatuses** - All statuses this conversation can move to. Will depend on its current status.
 * **listDescriptionTemplates** - A list of templates to start a new task description with.
 * **listLinkableTasks** - All tasks that can be linked to this one. Linked tasks allow you to automatically update the statuses of other tasks when changing the status of this one. DEPRECATED AND WILL BE REMOVED in favor of /linkable-tasks.

get.summary: Returns a list of linkable tasks for this project.

BadRequest.description: The method could not be executed because of bad request parameters.

Unauthorized.description: You are not authenticated or your authentication is no longer valid.

PaymentRequired.description: The account is suspended. The account owner must reactivate the account before this service can be accessed.

Forbidden.description: You do not have permission to access this resource.

RateLimit.description: The API rate limit has been exceeded for this time frame.
